com.pks.names.extension.pojo
Class NameList

java.lang.Object
  com.pks.names.extension.pojo.NameList
All Implemented Interfaces:
InameList
Direct Known Subclasses:
BankNameList
public class NameList
extends java.lang.Object
implements InameList

NameList is a simple ordered list of "wordInName" objects that represent words in some name Words are added once as a phrase and then exposed through simple functions Words may be returned in a variety of resulting strings to meet different uses. These may be extended readily.

Constructor Detail

NameList

public NameList(java.lang.String phrase,
                Dictionary dictionaryObject,
                java.lang.String spaceList,
                boolean isPerson,
                boolean stripLastBracket)
A constructor that takes a phrase and creates a word list

Parameters:
phrase - - the phrase to be broken into words that contain only letters and digits
dictionaryObject - - an instance of a Dictionary class to use instead of default. May be null to use default dictionary
spaceList - - a string with characters that are treated as spaces, if null then defaults to space, dash and ampersand
isPerson - - a parameter that indicates that matching is to be performed on the basis these are names of a real person this alters behaviour of initials and stemming.
stripLastBracket - - set to true if a last word is to be removed if in brackets. This is typically set to true if the nature of the name means that it might end with a parenthesised country e.g. if ABC Fencing (UK) is to match ABC Fencing

NameList

public NameList(java.lang.String phrase,
                java.lang.String spaceList,
                boolean isPerson,
                boolean stripLastBracket)
A constructor that takes a phrase and creates a word list. This constructor is deprecated in favour of the longer version that allows injection of a custom dictionary

Parameters:
phrase - - the phrase to be broken into words that contain only letters and digits
spaceList - - a string with characters that are treated as spaces, if null then defaults to space, dash and ampersand
isPerson - - a parameter that indicates that matching is to be performed on the basis these are names of a real person this alters behaviour of initials and stemming.
stripLastBracket - - set to true if a last word is to be removed if in brackets. This is typically set to true if the nature of the name means that it might end with a parenthesised country e.g. if ABC Fencing (UK) is to match ABC Fencing

public boolean equals(InameList nl)
an equality test between name lists. This performs only basic one to one tests of the lists and requires full matching of the words

Returns:
true if they are the same, false if they differ

acceptableMatch

public boolean acceptableMatch(InameList nl)

Acceptable match compare two names (held in InameList instances) that are expected to represent the same person albeit they may have formatting differences arising from different domains of usage. e.g. a bank account name may use different naming standards than a club membership.

This particular implementation performs the following, all not case sensitive:

  • equality
  • equality test if spaces removed, in case a space was omitted in data input
  • Missing middle initials case for people only, but first must match and last name must match and all provided intiials in order
  • non-person name count matches
  • people must match on 2 or more names
  • words must be in same order and each word must be a good match (not necessarily perfect), the definition of a good match is set in the WordInName implementation which has word comparators.
  • a special case for individuals in which initials are merged in one name but not the other

Specified by:
acceptableMatch in interface InameList
Parameters:
nl - : the nameList against which to compare. This object should be the person/thing clearest identifier and the parameter should be the candidate.
Returns:
true if the match is acceptable or the same, false otherwise
